ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn physiology for cell biologists. The histology was very interesting, even though it wasn't very in-depth.

This class encompasses an overview of physiological systems, including their function, related disease states, and histology. This is accompanied by histology sections once a week where the class discusses projected normal and abnormal histology images. There is a weekly homework assignment rather than exams. I would absolutely recommend this course. There was a very manageable workload and it provided insight into many different anatomical systems.
Overall, a great overview of histology, especially for those without a strong cell biology background.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: While not specifically preparing me for my thesis work, it provided an excellent overview of the macroscopic implications and organization of molecular-level events.
